lead_paragraph: The price of crude is up more than 40 percent since last month. But the stockpiles that drove prices down remain at 80-year highs.

headline.print_headline: Oil Prices Perk Up, Suggesting to Traders That Rebound Has Taken Hold
headline.main: Oil Prices Perk Up, Suggesting a Rebound Has Taken Hold

snippet: The price of crude is up more than 40 percent since last month. But the stockpiles that drove prices down remain at 80-year highs.
abstract: Commodity markets signal opinion that oil prices may have bottomed out after long tumble down to $26.21 a barrel in New York in February; crude prices rise 5.5 percent to $37.90 a barrel; outlook remains uncertain.
